name: Ochsner Health
description: Comprehensive healthcare design system based on Ochsner Health - Louisiana's largest nonprofit academic healthcare system. Features deep navy blue primary colors with gold accents, creating a trustworthy, professional, and compassionate healthcare experience.

brand.name: Ochsner Health
brand.mission: To Serve, Heal, Lead, Educate, and Innovate

button.name: Button
button.description: Primary action buttons with Ochsner navy blue branding. Gold accents for special CTAs.
button.usage:
## Button Usage

### Primary Actions
Use the default navy blue button for primary CTAs like booking appointments.

```tsx
<Button>Schedule Appointment</Button>
<Button variant="gold">Urgent Care</Button>
```

### Secondary Actions
```tsx
<Button variant="secondary">Learn More</Button>
<Button variant="outline">View Details</Button>
<Button variant="ghost">Cancel</Button>
```

### With Icons
```tsx
<Button leftIcon={<Calendar />}>Book Now</Button>
<Button rightIcon={<ArrowRight />}>Continue</Button>
```

### Loading State
```tsx
<Button loading>Processing...</Button>
```

do: Use primary navy buttons for main CTAs like 'Schedule Appointment'
Use gold buttons for urgent/emergency actions
Ensure minimum touch target of 44x44px for mobile
dont: Don't use multiple primary buttons in the same section
Don't use red for non-destructive actions
Don't disable buttons without explaining why
Don't use icon-only buttons without aria-label

badge.name: Badge
badge.description: Status indicators and labels for patient status, appointment types, and categorization.
badge.usage:
## Badge Usage

### Appointment Status
```tsx
<Badge variant="success">Confirmed</Badge>
<Badge variant="warning">Pending</Badge>
<Badge variant="destructive">Cancelled</Badge>
```

### Patient Categories
```tsx
<Badge variant="gold">New Patient</Badge>
<Badge variant="outline">Follow-up</Badge>
<Badge variant="default">Telehealth</Badge>
```

### Urgency Levels
```tsx
<Badge variant="destructive">Urgent</Badge>
<Badge variant="warning">Priority</Badge>
<Badge variant="secondary">Routine</Badge>
```

alert.name: Alert
alert.description: Important messages and notifications for patient communications, health alerts, and system messages.
alert.usage:
## Alert Usage

### Appointment Reminder
```tsx
<Alert variant="info">
  <Calendar className="h-4 w-4" />
  <AlertTitle>Appointment Tomorrow</AlertTitle>
  <AlertDescription>
    You have an appointment with Dr. Smith tomorrow at 2:00 PM.
    <Button variant="link" className="p-0 h-auto">Add to Calendar</Button>
  </AlertDescription>
</Alert>
```

### Test Results Ready
```tsx
<Alert variant="success">
  <CheckCircle className="h-4 w-4" />
  <AlertTitle>Test Results Available</AlertTitle>
  <AlertDescription>
    Your lab results from December 20 are now available.
    <Button variant="link">View Results</Button>
  </AlertDescription>
</Alert>
```

### Urgent Health Notice
```tsx
<Alert variant="destructive">
  <AlertTriangle className="h-4 w-4" />
  <AlertTitle>Urgent: Action Required</AlertTitle>
  <AlertDescription>
    Please contact your provider immediately regarding your recent test results.
    <Button variant="destructive" size="sm">Call Now</Button>
  </AlertDescription>
</Alert>
```

tabs.name: Tabs
tabs.description: Navigation tabs for organizing patient portal sections and health information categories.
tabs.usage:
## Tabs Usage

### Patient Portal Navigation
```tsx
<Tabs defaultValue="overview">
  <TabsList>
    <TabsTrigger value="overview">Overview</TabsTrigger>
    <TabsTrigger value="appointments">Appointments</TabsTrigger>
    <TabsTrigger value="records">Medical Records</TabsTrigger>
    <TabsTrigger value="messages">Messages</TabsTrigger>
    <TabsTrigger value="billing">Billing</TabsTrigger>
  </TabsList>
  
  <TabsContent value="overview">
    <PatientDashboard />
  </TabsContent>
  <TabsContent value="appointments">
    <AppointmentsList />
  </TabsContent>
  {/* ... other content */}
</Tabs>
```

### Pills Variant for Filtering
```tsx
<Tabs variant="pills" defaultValue="all">
  <TabsList>
    <TabsTrigger value="all">All Appointments</TabsTrigger>
    <TabsTrigger value="upcoming">Upcoming</TabsTrigger>
    <TabsTrigger value="past">Past</TabsTrigger>
  </TabsList>
</Tabs>
```

dialog.description: Modal dialogs for confirmations, forms, and important interactions.
dialog.usage:
## Dialog Usage ### Appointment Confirmation ```tsx Confirm Appointment You're about to schedule an appointment with Dr. Smith.

Date: January 15, 2025

Time: 2:00 PM

Location: Ochsner Medical Center

 ``` ### Cancel Appointment Confirmation ```tsx Cancel Appointment? Are you sure you want to cancel your appointment with Dr. Smith on January 15? This action cannot be undone. Keep Appointment Yes, Cancel ```

select.name: Select
select.description: Dropdown select menus for forms and filtering.
select.usage:
## Select Usage

### Department Selection
```tsx
<Select>
  <SelectTrigger>
    <SelectValue placeholder="Select department" />
  </SelectTrigger>
  <SelectContent>
    <SelectItem value="primary">Primary Care</SelectItem>
    <SelectItem value="cardiology">Cardiology</SelectItem>
    <SelectItem value="orthopedics">Orthopedics</SelectItem>
    <SelectItem value="neurology">Neurology</SelectItem>
    <SelectItem value="oncology">Oncology</SelectItem>
    <SelectItem value="pediatrics">Pediatrics</SelectItem>
  </SelectContent>
</Select>
```

### Location Filter
```tsx
<Select>
  <SelectTrigger>
    <SelectValue placeholder="Choose location" />
  </SelectTrigger>
  <SelectContent>
    <SelectGroup>
      <SelectLabel>New Orleans</SelectLabel>
      <SelectItem value="omc">Ochsner Medical Center</SelectItem>
      <SelectItem value="obc">Ochsner Baptist</SelectItem>
    </SelectGroup>
    <SelectGroup>
      <SelectLabel>Baton Rouge</SelectLabel>
      <SelectItem value="obr">Ochsner Baton Rouge</SelectItem>
    </SelectGroup>
  </SelectContent>
</Select>
```

messaging.name: Secure Messaging
messaging.description: HIPAA-compliant messaging between patients and care team.

guidelines:
# Ochsner Health Design System Guidelines

## Brand Overview

Ochsner Health is Louisiana's largest nonprofit academic healthcare system, serving patients across Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, and the Gulf South. This design system embodies Ochsner's commitment to compassionate, innovative, and accessible healthcare.

## Core Values Reflected in Design

### Trustworthy
- Deep navy blue conveys stability and expertise
- Clean, uncluttered layouts
- Consistent patterns build familiarity

### Compassionate
- Warm gold accents humanize the experience
- Clear, jargon-free language
- Accessible design for all abilities

### Innovative
- Modern, forward-looking aesthetic
- Smooth animations and transitions
- Progressive enhancement

## Color Philosophy

### Primary Navy (#0e203a)
- Main brand color representing trust and expertise
- Use for primary CTAs, navigation, and key UI elements
- Conveys professionalism and reliability

### Gold Accent (#e0a42e)
- Represents warmth, care, and urgency
- Use for important callouts, urgent actions, and highlights
- Creates visual hierarchy and draws attention

### Supporting Palette
- **Success Green (#10b981)**: Confirmations, positive status, health indicators
- **Warning Amber (#f59e0b)**: Pending actions, reminders, attention needed
- **Error Red (#dc2626)**: Errors, cancellations, urgent alerts
- **Info Blue (#0e203a)**: Informational notices (same as primary)

## Typography

### Montserrat (Headings)
- Modern geometric sans-serif
- Use Semibold (600) or Bold (700) for headings
- Conveys modernity and approachability

### Roboto (Body)
- Highly readable at all sizes
- Excellent for medical information display
- Use Regular (400) for body, Medium (500) for emphasis

## Healthcare UX Principles

### 1. Clarity Above All
- Medical information must be immediately understandable
- Use plain language over medical jargon
- Provide context for health metrics and results

### 2. Accessibility First
- WCAG 2.1 AA compliance minimum
- 4.5:1 contrast ratio for all text
- Full keyboard navigation support
- Screen reader optimized
- Touch targets minimum 44x44px

### 3. Build Trust
- Secure indicators for sensitive areas
- Clear privacy notices
- Consistent, predictable patterns
- Professional, clean aesthetic

### 4. Patient-Centered
- Easy appointment scheduling
- Clear health information display
- Mobile-first responsive design
- Quick access to urgent features

### 5. Reduce Cognitive Load
- Progressive disclosure
- Sensible defaults
- Clear error recovery
- Contextual help

## Do's and Don'ts

### Do
- Use navy blue for primary actions and navigation
- Use gold for urgent or special CTAs
- Maintain clean, spacious layouts
- Provide clear feedback for all actions
- Use icons alongside text for clarity
- Group related information in cards

### Don't
- Don't use bright neon colors
- Don't overcrowd screens
- Don't use small fonts for health data
- Don't hide critical actions
- Don't use medical jargon without explanation
- Don't make assumptions about user ability

## Responsive Breakpoints

- **Mobile**: < 640px - Single column, stacked layout
- **Tablet**: 640px - 1024px - Two column where appropriate
- **Desktop**: > 1024px - Full layout with sidebars

## Animation Guidelines

- Use 200ms for micro-interactions
- Use 300ms for page transitions
- Ease-out for entering elements
- Ease-in for exiting elements
- Respect prefers-reduced-motion

requirements: All interactive elements must be keyboard accessible
Focus indicators must be visible (2px solid gold ring)
Form inputs must have associated labels
Error messages must be announced to screen readers
Color must not be the only indicator of state
Text must be resizable to 200% without loss of content
testing: Screen reader testing with NVDA and VoiceOver
